definition[0]: a signed document ordering someone to pay someone else a particular amount of money
definition[1]: a document ordering someone to pay a particular amount on a fixed date, used especially in international trade
example[0]: The exporter’s bank sends the bill of exchange to its overseas branch in the importer’s country.
example[1]: When the buyer accepts a bill of exchange (=agrees to pay it), the exporter may arrange for it to be discounted.
example[2]: Essing dishonoured fourbills of exchange (=failed to pay them) drawn by Byrd to the amount of £2.39 million.
